solution_line_template: Two kilograms of pasta cost ${pasta_cost_per_kg} x {pasta_kg} = $<<{pasta_cost_per_kg}*{pasta_kg}={total_pasta_cost}>>{total_pasta_cost}.
One-fourth kilogram of ground beef cost ${beef_cost_per_kg} x {beef_kg_fraction} = $<<{beef_cost_per_kg}*{beef_kg_fraction}={total_beef_cost}>>{total_beef_cost}.
Two jars of pasta sauce cost ${sauce_cost_per_jar} x {sauce_jars} = $<<{sauce_cost_per_jar}*{sauce_jars}={total_sauce_cost}>>{total_sauce_cost}.

The total cost for the pasta, beef, and sauce is ${total_pasta_cost} + ${total_beef_cost} + ${total_sauce_cost} = $<<{total_pasta_cost}+{total_beef_cost}+{total_sauce_cost}={cost_food_items}>>{cost_food_items}.
Since Mica also wants to buy Quesadilla, she should have ${cost_food_items} + ${quesadilla_cost} = $<<{cost_food_items}+{quesadilla_cost}={total_money_needed}>>{total_money_needed}.
